description:
Trying to make a get_diagnostics call on recent Nova folsom builds causes the following error in nova-compute.log:

2012-08-01 13:09:16 ERROR nova.openstack.common.rpc.common [-] ['Traceback (most recent call last):
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py", line 275, in _process_data
    rval = self.proxy.dispatch(ctxt, version, method, **args)
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py", line 145, in dispatch
    return getattr(proxyobj, method)(ctxt, **kwargs)
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/exception.py", line 117, in wrapped
    temp_level, payload)
', '  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 24, in __exit__
    self.gen.next()
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/exception.py", line 92, in wrapped
    return f(*args, **kw)
', 'TypeError: decorated_function() takes at least 3 arguments (2 given)
']

The fix seems to be to send instance_uuid=None along with the RPC call.

The compute manager expects the following:

    def get_diagnostics(self, context, instance_uuid=None, instance=None):

*** Note: that instance_uuid is before instance in this particular function.... Is there some sort of order dependency where NoneType arguments must be last for RPC?
title: Some RPC calls are missing arguments (diagnostics, consoles, etc.)

comments.content:
Trying to make a get_diagnostics call on recent Nova folsom builds causes the following error in nova-compute.log:

2012-08-01 13:09:16 ERROR nova.openstack.common.rpc.common [-] ['Traceback (most recent call last):
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/openstack/common/rpc/amqp.py", line 275, in _process_data
    rval = self.proxy.dispatch(ctxt, version, method, **args)
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/openstack/common/rpc/dispatcher.py", line 145, in dispatch
    return getattr(proxyobj, method)(ctxt, **kwargs)
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/exception.py", line 117, in wrapped
    temp_level, payload)
', '  File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/contextlib.py", line 24, in __exit__
    self.gen.next()
', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/exception.py", line 92, in wrapped
    return f(*args, **kw)
', 'TypeError: decorated_function() takes at least 3 arguments (2 given)
']

The fix seems to be to send instance_uuid=None along with the RPC call.

The compute manager expects the following:

    def get_diagnostics(self, context, instance_uuid=None, instance=None):

*** Note: that instance_uuid is before instance in this particular function.... Is there some sort of order dependency where NoneType arguments must be last for RPC?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince

comments.content: Note. I'm using Qpid on Fedora 17... not sure if this makes a difference though.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/10656
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
Just talked to russellb on IRC. Apparently the cause of this is most likely the wrap_instance_fault and checks_instance_lock decorators which work only when instance is passed as the first argument after the context.

Re-ordering the arguments should fix this...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~dan-prince

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/10656
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/5e7275f5bca9c7c6f30a442c3bd2b66eba19fe04
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 5e7275f5bca9c7c6f30a442c3bd2b66eba19fe04
Author: Dan Prince <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Aug 1 10:55:14 2012 -0400

    Fix get_diagnostics RPC arg ordering.
    
    Updates the ordering of the compute managers get_diagnostics
    call so it works correctly with the current wrap_instance_fault and
    checks_instance_lock decorators. To work correctly 'instance' needs
    to be the first argument after the context.
    
    Fixes LP Bug #1031788.
    
    Change-Id: Ia7105eb272cd2932fc4f25b297ecab9e5ab8dbe2
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
